Chapter 2 Bayesian models 2.1 Regression example 2.2 Sources

Chapter 2 Bayesian models 2.1 Regression example Assume a Poisson probability model: \(Y|x \sim Poisson(\theta_{x})\) \(Y\): number of offspring \(x\): age of bird Poisson regression model with log-link \(Y|x \sim Poisson(exp(\mathbf{\beta}^T\textbf{x}))\) where \(logE[Y|x] = log(\theta_x) = \beta_1+\beta_2x+\beta_3x^2\). set.seed(1) x = rnorm(10) y = rnorm(10) Plot. plot(x,y) 2.2 Sources Adapted from lecture notes by Dr Bronwyn Loong for STAT7016 at ANU. Reference: Hoff, Peter D. (2000). A First Course in Bayesian Statistical Methods. Springer.
